ygData.subject: Re: The Ramora

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

       Hell Beast and his team retired to a section of the ship that was 
granted to them. It contained a larger bunker room where they would sleep on 
bunk beds. A small cooking area, and seating area filled the rest of the 
section. It was large enough to fit the 12 someodd Predacons comfortablely. 
And, Tarantulas noticed first of all, there were no computers.
       "The Newcomers base will be a fairly easy task. Tarantulas, Black 
Aracnia, and Paddletail will use the scanning equitment to pinpoint the 
materials needed. Tankkor and Craken will piolt and drive the materials back 
here. The rest of us will dig it up."
       Black Aracnia was the first to object. "What are we looking for 
anyways?" She said in a sharp attitude.
       Hell Beast turned to face her. "My dear, the information given to me 
is very covert. I cannot at this time reveal it to you." Turning away he 
quietly added, "Scheming spider..."
       The Predacons all bunked down for the night. Each taking a bed and 
sleeping the set dormate period programmed into thier main processors. The 
morning brought the hussling about and thudding of heavey feet.
       
       The ruins of the ship gleammed in the morning sun as the Predacons 
descended apon it. Craters of the blast contained scrap metal, and clearly 
the toll of time and nature was visable.
       The Predacons quickly set to work. The picks and mining equitment was 
abundant due to the original plans of digging for energon. But those plans, 
like so many others, had been long forgotten in this climatic struggle.
       The morning proved successful with the discovery of computer 
motherboards and valuable personal databases. The programming chips of CR 
chambers were mealted, and a bit scourged, but salvageable. All that was 
needed was vessles initial computer program contained in the large computer 
core. No doubt it would be broken, and craked, but Tarantulas ensured he 
could get the information needed out of it.
       Morning soon turned into the heat of the afternoon, and the Egyption 
sun was truly a force the Predacons could not deal with. Theyre dark armor 
began to bake them. Taking shelter in the ruins, the Predacons would resume 
at dusk.

--part1_3e.8f5eb97.27e6d8d3_boundary
